p: Pathogenesis-related (PR) proteins have been used as markers of plant defense responses. In order to further investigate whether the plant defense genes were stimulated by infection with Δ Mosec61β, the expression patterns of PBZ1 and PR1a genes were analyzed through quantitative RT-PCR. PBZ1, a probenazole-inducible gene from rice, triggers non-race specific resistance in rice plants against rice blast fungus [ 25]. PR1a is one of the PR proteins, which accumulates after blast fungus infection in rice [ 26]. The expression level of PBZ1 was up-regulated in leaves of blast-fungus-challenged rice at 24 hpi, 32 hpi, and 48 hpi, whereas there were no obvious differences in Δ Mosec61β or Guy11-challenged rice leaves (Fig. S5a). In contrast, the expression level of PR1a in leaves of Δ Mosec61β-challenged rice was higher than that in leaves of Guy11-challenged rice at 24 hpi and 48 hpi (Fig. S5B). The expression level of PR1a in leaves of Δ Mosec61β-challenged rice at 24 hpi was 4 folds as high as that in leaves of Guy11-challenged rice (Fig. S5b). The induction of plant defense responses in Δ Mosec61β-challenged rice may contribute to the retardation of IH development.
